item.title: Genshin Impact: Zhongli Best Weapons
item.description:
Zhongli

Geo

Polearm

Liyue

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

As one of the best characters in Genshin Impact , it’s no surprise that Zhongli exists on top of every tier list. Zhongli is one of the best shielders in the game, where he easily provides unbreakable protection with 100% uptime. With Zhongli in the team, players can practically forget the need to dodge as long as they remember to refresh his shield.

Although Vortex Vanquisher was made to be featured alongside the Geo Archon, it's not Zhongli's best weapons in Genshin Impact . Instead, players can consider the following Polearms.

Updated on December 11, 2024, by Nahda Nabiilah: With many new updates and additions, more characters and weapons are added to Genshin Impact. For that, many characters rise and fall in power because of the game’s constant Meta change. Zhongli suffered before from the lack of HP% Polearm as only Black Tassel was available to improve his shield. Now, there are new options for a better shield for Zhongli and a better performance overall. Here’s an updated list of the best weapons for Zhongli in Genshin Impact .

7 The Catch

  • Primary Stat : 510 ATK
  • Secondary Stat : 45.9% Energy Recharge
  • R5 Passive : Increases Elemental Burst DMG by 32% and Elemental Burst CRIT Rate by 12%.

“ The Catch ” can be obtained by exchanging some fish to the Inazuma Fishing Association in Genshin Impact . This weapon is amazing for any sub-DPS that relies on their Elemental Burst as it enhances Burst DMG and helps Energy restoration through its Energy Recharge sub-stat. For Zhongli , The Catch helps magnify his meteor damage and allows him to cast it more often, making it easy for players to petrify enemies on the battlefield frequently.

6 Skyward Spine

  • Primary Stat : 674 ATK
  • Secondary Stat : 36.8% Energy Recharge
  • Passive : Increases CRIT Rate by 8% and increases Normal ATK SPD by 12%. Additionally, Normal and Charged Attacks hits on opponents have a 50% chance to trigger a vacuum blade that deals 40% of ATK as DMG in a small AoE. This effect can occur no more than once every 2s.

Similar to other Energy Recharge weapons, Skyward Spine is also great for Zhongli as it eases his Energy restoration process. However, as a 5-star Genshin Impact weapon, Skyward Spine has a larger Base ATK, which means Zhongli will deal larger damage. Other than that, though, Skyward Spine offers nothing more to the Geo Archon as the rest of its passive is catered to support a main DPS.

5 Rightful Reward

  • Primary Stat: 565 ATK
  • Secondary Stat: 27.6% HP
  • R5 Passive: When the wielder is healed, restore 16 Energy. This effect can triggered once every 10s, and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

It’s not ideal to pair Zhongli with a healer, since he can carry the team’s sustainability with his unbreakable shield. However, sometimes players will pair Zhongli with characters like Furina in Genshin Impact , who has some healing capabilities. Getting a certain amount of Energy every rotation helps Zhongli cast his Elemental Burst more often, which helps the team’s CC.

On the other hand, Rightful Reward’s passive is not that good for Zhongli when it comes to content like the Spiral Abyss. In these types of game modes, players want their character to do their job and rotate as fast as possible, and having Zhongli send down a meteor is the last thing players want for a fast rotation. For that, Rightful Reward is only beneficial for Zhongli because of its 27% HP Sub-stat, but worth the investment since it’s an F2P Fontaine forgeable weapon in Genshin Impact .

4 Dialogues of the Desert Sages

  • Primary Stat: 510 ATK
  • Secondary Stat: 41.3% HP
  • R5 Passive: When the wielder performs healing, restore 16 Energy. This effect can be triggered once every 10s and can occur even when the character is not on the field.

Passive-wise, Dialogues of the Desert Sages offers nothing for Zhongli because he won’t heal unless Zhongli is a C6. However, the F2P 4-star weapon carries a 41% HP Secondary Stat, which can be great for Zhongli’s shield in Genshin Impact . Most players should have the R5 version of the Dialogues of the Desert Sages Polearm since the weapon and its refinements were given as rewards for participating in the Alchemical Ascension Event in Genshin Impact 4.5.

3 Black Tassel

  • Primary Stat : 354 ATK
  • Secondary Stat : 46.9% HP
  • R5 Passive : Increases DMG against slimes by 80%.

Black Tassel is amazing for Zhongli as it strengthens his HP stat. This Polearm is not the best in terms of damage, but if players are building their Zhongli to be a dedicated Genshin Impact shielder, then Black Tassel is one of the best options for him.

2 Favonius Lance

  • Primary Stat : 565 ATK
  • Secondary Stat : 30.6% Energy Recharge
  • R5 Passive : CRIT Hits have a 100% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 6s.

Favonius Lance is great to boost Zhongli as a support in Genshin Impact . It offers less damage output compared to other Polearms, but with Favonius Lance, Zhongli can help the entire team regenerate their Energy, taking on an extra role as a Genshin Impact Battery.

1 Staff of Homa

  • Primary Stat : 608 ATK
  • Secondary Stat : 66.2% CRIT DMG
  • Passive : HP increased by 20%. Additionally, provides an ATK Bonus based on 0.8% of the wielder's Max HP. When the wielder's HP is less than 50%, this ATK bonus is increased by an additional 1% of Max HP.

Staff of Homa is the perfect weapon for Zhongli . It grants HP stat that’ll enhance his shield in Genshin Impact , but on top of that, the Polearm also converts some of that HP into ATK. This, accompanied by the weapon’s large CRIT DMG secondary stat, means that Zhongli will be enhanced in both offense and defense.

item.title: Marvel Rivals: 10 Best Default Costumes For Characters, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Marvel Rivals adapts iconic Marvel heroes and villains with unique visual styles to stand out in the world of Marvel video games.
  • Characters like Psylocke and The Punisher show what can be done with creative liberties with famous character designs.
  • NetEase Games' attention to detail, distinct gameplay styles, and iconic designs make characters like Cloak & Dagger and Hawkeye stand out.

With the successful launch of Marvel Rivals , comic book fans and gamers are introduced to their favorite Marvel characters in a new way. Not only is it a hero shooter in the same vein as Overwatch and Rogue Company , but it adapts famous Marvel heroes and villains in their defining visual style.

In some cases, the characters match their comic book counterparts, or some are radically different, but in a good way. The visuals are the first thing that hooks a player into the characters and NetEase Games have provided the community with a plethora of instantly memorable default costumes to do just that and help Marvel Rivals stand out from other games.

10 The Punisher

Frank Castle Would Fit In Other Third-Person Shooters

  • Class: Duelist
  • Difficulty: 1/5
  • First Appearance: The Amazing Spider-Man #129

Frank Castle has had many looks over the years as The Punisher , from a simple t-shirt and pants with the skull logo to resembling a spec ops operative. Marvel Rivals leans more to the latter, with armor from top to bottom, but more fantastical in design combined with white skull warpaint on his face and ridiculously large proportions.

As a result of NetEase Games' redesign, The Punisher can be compared to characters from the Gears Of War franchise, but in a good way. It matches the tone of Punisher in the game with his ultra-edgy disposition while wielding an assault rifle, shotgun, machine gun turret, and exo-suit used to mow through enemies.

9 Jeff The Land Shark

The Cutest Shark That Has Ever Lived

  • Class: Strategist
  • Difficulty: 2/5
  • First Appearance: West Coast Avengers #6

Characters like Yoshi from the Mario Universe show that cuteness can enhance a great character even further, and that is the case with Jeff The Land Shark . Likely, few expected the dog-like shark with legs to be a part of a hero shooter like this, but he quickly won over players' hearts with his big eyes, innocence, and puppy-like demeanor that made him look like a living plushie doll.

The overall design for Jeff The Land Shark is effectively adorable, but Jon Bailey's high-pitched vocalizations for the character make him even more enjoyable. Add in animations like swimming on his back to go backward and eating a fish to refresh his attacks. Even the fact that he shoots bubbles and jet streams to heal teammates is cute in concept and in gameplay.

8 Magik

The Ultimate Goth Warrior Of Limbo

  • Class: Duelist
  • Difficulty: 3/5
  • First Appearance: Giant-Size X-Men #1

In the comics, Magik is known for her combination of black outfits and bits of armor, to help deliver a mix of an urban gothic aesthetic and a little bit of punk. Marvel Rivals takes that concept and amps it up, with Magik having more extravagant armor pieces to make her even more warrior-like, akin to an emo-punk WarCraft character.

The attention to detail is to be commended, with her shirt and leggings being tattered to not only show off the character's nonchalant personality but also enhance her punk aesthetic. Adding in her massive sword and the game's unique visual style are just icing on top of the cake, which is a top-tier Magik design.

7 Cloak & Dagger

Two Exquisitely Designed Characters For The Price Of One

  • Class: Strategist
  • Difficulty: 3/5
  • First Appearance: Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man #64

NetEase Games showed their commitment to characters' lore while creating distinct gameplay styles, such as with Cloak & Dagger . They are two characters in one and the player is forced to swap between them for different abilities: damage or healing. Just the visual of them swapping is dynamic and never stops the flow of matches, which is worthy of praise already.

However, Cloak & Dagger both feature their own unique details, with Cloak appearing as a ghostly void that floats around while Dagger runs with distinct animations as well as abilities. On top of it all, their light and dark appearances are like opposites, yet complement each other enough to give them an iconic look as a duo.

6 Thor

The God Of Thunder Aged Like Fine Wine

  • Class: Vanguard
  • Difficulty: 2/5
  • First Appearance: Journey Into Mystery #83

Rather than the typical youthful Thor that fans are used to, Marvel Rivals has an older Thor with graying hair, a longer beard, and more mature features. He also wears a less ornate uniform, with runic armor, pelts, and a red shirt with rugged gauntlets that are clearly references to his Unworthy era in the comics.

It fits his lore within the game as a Thor who was banished by Loki from the timeline and makes him look like a Viking warrior closer to his father, Odin All-Father. Compared to most Marvel Rivals characters, Thor is a bit more grounded, which could have made him not fit in with everyone else, but instead, the older Thor stands out in the best way.

5 Psylocke

Her New Japanese Origins Gave Her An Iconic Look

  • Class: Duelist
  • Difficulty: 5/5
  • First Appearance: Captain Britain #8

The developers use a lot of Eastern influence in Marvel Rivals and Psylocke is a prime example of that. Taking influence from Demon Days: X-Men , Psylocke has her purple hair, a scarf, and overall aesthetic that fans expect from the character, but updated just enough to match the developers' vision of a demon-slaying warrior from Japan.

Psylocke still has her signature blade and psionic powers, but they are expanded upon in the best way possible. Now Psylocke looks, sounds, and feels like a character found in an anime, showcasing that change from the comics is not inherently a bad thing.

4 Hawkeye

Culmination Of Clint Barton's Costumes And Careers

  • Class: Duelist
  • Difficulty: 4/5
  • First Appearance: Tales Of Suspense #57

Over the many years of being a member of the Avengers, Hawkeye has been seen in various costumes across movies, video games, and animation, with some remaining iconic. Hawkeye's costume in Marvel Rivals feels like the developers took bits and pieces of them all and fused them.

One of the better ideas NetEase Games implemented was having pieces of Clint Barton's other vigilante persona, the Ronin. He wields a Japanese blade, mask, and scarf that elevate his purple superhero costume to resemble a shinobi, while also granting him some of Ronin's abilities in-game.

3 Storm

An Instant Classic That Shows Love To Ororo's Comic Book History

  • Class: Duelist
  • Difficulty: 3/5
  • First Appearance: Giant-Size X-Men #1

Storm is known for her regality and elegance combined with a fierce intensity as a leader of the X-Men and her costume is meant to enhance that. NetEase Games seemed to understand that, creating a suit that fits the fantastical aesthetics of Marvel Rivals while still maintaining the blueprint of Storm that gives her a queen-like appearance.

Additionally, Storm features a reference from the comics: her hair derives from her famous mohawk look from the 1980s. Little details go a long way with fans, showing respect for the source material while making a fresh yet familiar suit to stand out with the Marvel Rivals visuals and gameplay.

2 Venom

Sticking To The Basics Works For The Lethal Protector

  • Class: Vanguard
  • Difficulty: 3/5
  • First Appearance: The Amazing Spider-Man #300

Developers seem to love bringing Venom to life in video games, given how often the character is seen, Marvel Rivals included. Venom's costume is as classic of a Venom as one can get. He's a massive, sharp-toothed, slimy alien monster with a long tongue and a white spider emblem sprawling across his chest but executed just right to make Venom look stellar.

Sometimes there is no need to fix what isn't broken, but that's not to say NetEase Games didn't put any flair on Venom. The Marvel Rivals version has Venom with a constant swirl of symbiote matter swimming through his body and top-heavy proportions. The visual style of Marvel Rivals gives the lethal protector so much expression and personality in his movements.

1 Moon Knight

The Fist Of Vengeance's Armor Shines Like The Moon

  • Class: Duelist
  • Difficulty: 3/5
  • First Appearance: Werewolf By Night #32

While Moon Knight is not new to the world of Marvel video gaming, he has rarely had an iconic appearance. Thankfully, Marvel Rivals goes all out with him, mixing ancient Egyptian mythology, styles, and culture with a healthy blend of modernized superhero elements that are used just enough to make Moon Knight stand out.

The armor fittingly makes him look like a knight to a god without looking too busy, but Moon Knight also sports design aspects meant to reference the god he serves: Khonshu. For example, his hood resembles the bird skull that Khonshu takes the form of in the comics. Other pieces of the costume, such as the cape becoming a crescent and the Ankh symbols are nice bonuses.

item.title: Demon Slayer is Having a Major Gaming Moment
item.description:
Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba , or Demon Slayer for short, has only been around for 8 years, but it's quickly climbed up the ranks to become one of the most successful entertainment properties of all time. Although the franchise was initially conceived as a shonen manga series, it has since expanded into many other mediums, including anime, stage plays, films, and, of course, video games. The Demon Slayer manga, which ran from 2016 to 2020, has sold at least 150 million copies worldwide, while its TV show adaptation has become the most-watched anime of 2024, garnering more than 15 million viewers in Japan alone.

2024 has been a particularly eventful year for Demon Slayer fans. The long-awaited fourth season of Demon Slayer 's anime, which adapted the 15th and 16th volumes of the manga, aired over the summer and was met with mostly positive reviews. Meanwhile, the compilation film Demon Slayer - Kimetsu no Yaiba - To the Hashiro Training was released in theaters earlier this year. Demon Slayer -themed attractions were even opened at Universal Studios Japan and Araneta City in mid-2024. On top of all that, the franchise has been active in the world of gaming, as well, in terms of both new game releases and announcements.

Demon Slayer is Making a Pretty Big Splash Into the Realm of Video Games

Compilation films aren't new, standalone movies; they're essentially just TV show episodes that have been merged together for a theatrical release. Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - To the Hashiro Training includes the finale of the third season and the first episode of the fourth season.

A Mario Party-Style Demon Slayer Game Was Released This Year

Back in April 2024, Cyberconnect2 and Sega released a digital tabletop game called Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - Sweep the Board for the Nintendo Switch. The game, for those who are unaware, is very similar to Mario Party concept-wise. In it, players move characters around grid-based boards and partake in various minigames with up to four friends. Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - Sweep the Board features 14 playable characters and 6 stages inspired by the hit anime. In addition, it can be played both online and offline.

Despite launching as a Switch exclusive , Sweep the Board was ported to PlayStation 4/5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, and Windows PC on July 26. The fact that Sega decided to bring the game to all last- and current-gen platforms is worth commending. Even if Sweep the Board may not be as fleshed out as, say , Super Mario Party Jamboree , it is still a solid party game to play with friends, and a great alternative to Mario Party for those who don't have a Switch.

Demon Slayer: The Hinokami Chronicles 2 is in the Works, and It's Launching in 2025

Although Sweep the Board was released only a few months ago, Sega and Cyberconnect 2 have already announced their next Demon Slayer video game. Earlier this week, the two companies confirmed that they were working on a sequel to the 2021 fighting action game Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - The Hinokami Chronicles . According to Sega, this follow-up to the hit 3D fighter is going to have new playable characters and a brand-new story mode that adapts the last three arcs of the Demon Slayer anime. Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - The Hinokami Chronicles 2 is scheduled to release on all modern consoles sometime in 2025.

Demon Slayer May Be Coming to Fortnite Very Soon

Hinokami Chronicles 2 may not be the only Demon Slayer -related video game content to look forward to next year because, if rumors are true, Fortnite may be collaborating with the series in the near future. The reputable insider Shiina alleged in a tweet last month that a Demon Slayer and Fortnite crossover was "coming soon," though they stopped short of providing an exact release date. While it's best to approach this report with caution, the notion of Demon Slayer popping up in Epic Games' battle royale doesn't seem too absurd, especially considering the game's latest season, subtitled HUNTERS , is themed entirely around Japanese culture. Therefore, Fortnite collaborating with anime franchises like this one makes perfect sense.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Jeff and Scarlet Witch Wombo Combo is Genius
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Players discover a powerful combo using Jeff the Land Shark and Scarlet Witch in Marvel Rivals.
  • Strategic use of abilities can create effective unofficial combos in Marvel Rivals.
  • Coordination is key among teammates to unleash devastating combos.

Marvel Rivals players have discovered a powerful combo using Jeff the Land Shark and Scarlet Witch. Marvel Rivals features all kinds of powerful Ultimate attacks for players to unleash on their opponents, though these Ultimates can be even deadlier when used in tandem with teammates.

Marvel Rivals has dedicated team-up abilities, with Hulk able to throw Wolverine as a callback to their famous "Fastball" move and Rocket Raccoon able to ride on Groot's shoulder. Players can also get creative with the abilities at their disposal for unofficial team-up attacks. Especially effective combos come from strategically combining Ultimate attacks to devastate the enemy team, aka Wombo Combos, and one of the deadliest has now been discovered by the Marvel Rivals community.

TikTok user alexmcgill26 recently commented on one of JepJeb's videos, pointing out that Jeff the Land Shark and Scarlet Witch can combine their Ultimate attacks to completely wipe out enemy teams. JepJeb then tested this out and uploaded the results. As shown in the video, if timed correctly, Jeff the Land Shark can swallow the enemy team using his Ultimate, and then spit the enemies straight into the air. Scarlet Witch can then unleash her Ultimate attack, which should completely wipe out the enemy team.

Marvel Rivals Jeff and Scarlet Witch Combo

This devastating combo could be put to great use in Marvel Rivals competitive matches, though it will require coordination among teammates. This combo could also help Jeff's Ultimate be more effective on maps where he can't easily spit his opponents off a cliff. Of course, this isn't the only effective combo that players can pull off in the game.

Another one I've seen involving Scarlet Witch and her ult has to do with Doctor Strange. By strategically using Doctor Strange's portals, Scarlet Witch can get the jump on the enemy team, passing through the portals and unleashing her Ult before her opponents even know what's going on. These powerful abilities can result in genius plays, though it's always possible that nerfs and balance changes will render some of these strategies obsolete.

NetEase Games has released Marvel Rivals updates focused on fixing bugs and other technical issues, but it has yet to make any major balance changes to the hero shooter. Some in the community have voiced their hope that Marvel Rivals doesn't nerf the fun out of the game and keeps the overpowered abilities, while others have called for tweaks to overpowered characters. Regardless, it will be interesting to see what happens to the Marvel Rivals roster in future updates, and what fresh combos new heroes may bring to the table.

item.title: Why Spider-Man Could Be the Key to Stabilizing Marvel Rivals’ Fractured Realities
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Spider-Man's intrinsic connection to the multiverse may play a crucial role in Marvel Rivals' Timestream Entanglement.
  • Spider-Man's sense of responsibility sets him apart as a leader in uniting heroes against Doom in Marvel Rivals.
  • Spider-Man may be the key to restoring fractured timelines due to his abilities and willingness to sacrifice.

Spider-Man has always been one of Marvel's most beloved and relatable heroes, but in Marvel Rivals , he may ascend to a role of greater significance than he has ever assumed before. Marvel Rivals may be a hero shooter, but it is far from a generic one thanks to its deep lore, which sees a phenomenon called the Timestream Entanglement pulling multiple timelines together into one reality, bringing different versions of Marvel's most iconic heroes and villains together where they must decide to set aside their differences and ally together against the overarching antagonists, Doom and his 2099 counterpart, or remain in their longstanding rivalries.

As Marvel Rivals ' Timestream Entanglement leaves the multiverse in chaotic disrepair, Peter Parker finds himself at the center of that chaos, with inherent abilities that may be the key to restoring timelines. While he is ushered into a fight to protect the Web of Life and Destiny from Doom's forces, he is still arguably positioned more than anyone else to deal with such a catastrophe in the multiverse and restore realities to their original state. This is all due to his inherent abilities and sense of personal responsibility, both of which have been known to catapult him to success in other stories.

Spider-Man Looks Primed to Resolve the Timestream Entanglement

Spider-Man Has an Inherent Connection to the Multiverse

The most prominent reason Spider-Man might play a significant role in the future of Marvel Rivals ' story is due to his inherent connection to the multiverse, since that is precisely what is at stake in the game's narrative. The Web of Life and Destiny, particularly, serves as the backbone of the multiverse, linking together all of its Spider-Totems and realities. Since Spider-Man is, in fact, a Spider-Totem, he has an innately more important place in the structure of the multiverse than other heroes, thereby increasing his significance in Marvel Rivals ' Timestream Entanglement narrative. Furthermore, since Spider-Man has access to the Web, he is able to discover disturbances in its framework and stabilize them, unlike most of Marvel Rivals ' other heroes.

As Marvel Rivals ' Timestream Entanglement leaves the multiverse in chaotic disrepair, Peter Parker finds himself at the center of that chaos, with inherent abilities that may be the key to restoring timelines.

In Marvel Rivals , the role Spider-Man may play in the Timestream Entanglement narrative is brought even more into the light as Spider-Zero opens a portal in Spider-Man's reality and begs for his help protecting the Web of Life and Destiny. The very fact that Spider-Zero specifically sought Peter Parker's help effectively underscores his significance in the overarching story yet to play out, and while Spider-Man is not the only one with an inherent connection to the multiverse, it could be his enduring sense of responsibility that distinguishes him.

Spider-Man Has a Sense of Responsibility Many Other Heroes Lack

At the heart of almost every Spider-Man story is the internal conflict between his personal struggles and his commitment to the greater good, and that is still very much a significant element of his story in Marvel Rivals . However, by the end of the first part of his story, it is heavily implied that Spider-Man has chosen the greater good, though that won't be revealed until later. In light of that, it shows a sense of responsibility present within Spider-Man that many other heroes lack. His willingness to make sacrifices and set aside his own interests for the greater good is arguably a defining characteristic of a leader, setting him up to take center stage in Marvel Rivals ' future.

As Marvel Rivals ' story continues to unfold, Spider-Man's role in the Timestream Entanglement will become clearer, proving whether he is merely a small part of a much greater whole or if he is as vital as he seems he will be. His intrinsic connection to the Web of Life and Destiny not only makes him uniquely equipped to navigate the chaos of the fractured multiverse but also positions him as a pivotal figure capable of uniting heroes and villains against Doom’s destructive ambitions. If his inherent abilities don't get him there, perhaps his willingness to prioritize the greater good over personal struggles will cement him as a key leader in Marvel Rivals ' story.
